metadata.title: CVE-2018-5153 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
If websocket data is sent with mixed text and binary in a single message,the binary data can be corrupted. This can result in an out-of-bounds readwith the read memory sent to the originating server in response. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 60.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5153` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 60.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '60.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
